page.title: 14POLITICAL ATTITUDES
page.content:
A number of people were stopped in the street and asked about their political affiliations. Many refused to answer, but of those that did, 75% voted in general elections and only 50% in local elections for County Councillors. This indicated a general apathy for politics which the people of Carclaze seem to share with the British public in general. When asked why they tended to turn out for general rather than local elections, most said that Parliament has overall power and local Councils are subordinate.
Despite St.Austell being in the centre of the china clay industry, there is little support for the Labour Party. 50% of the respondents voted conservative, 36% Liberal, and 16% Labour. The local MP is a Liberal.
